title: AMD calls AI ‘underhyped’ at IFA Berlin — chipmaker says the ‘perfect PC’ comes first
summary: At IFA 2025, AMD delivered a less dramatic defense of its long-term strategy and outlined its vision for AI and the future of the PC.

title: Microsoft offers a one-year free Microsoft 365 subscription to college students — eligible users get 50% off the monthly plan after the first year
summary: Microsoft is offering U.S. college students free access to Microsoft 365 for a year.

title: Nvidia says 'We never deprive American customers in order to serve the rest of the world' — company says GAIN AI Act addresses a problem that doesn't exist
summary: Nvidia says that the U.S. legislators' attempt to restrict exports unnecessarily is counterproductive, as the U.S. is already its top priority.

summary: AMD has just launched the Ryzen 5 9500F in China, after weeks of leaks spoiled its arrival. title: AMD prototype Radeon AI Pro R9700 found by 'a friend,' posted to Reddit — a real-life reference design model of AMD's artistic render
summary: Someone discovered an engineering sample of the Radeon AI Pro 9700 GPU with 32GB of VRAM and they're asking what to do with it.

title: Anthropic to pay $1.5B over pirated books in Claude AI training — payouts of roughly $3,000 per infringed work
summary: Anthropic has agreed to pay at least $1.5 billion to settle a class-action lawsuit brought by authors over the use of pirated books in training its large language models.

summary: The Seagate Exos M sets a new record for single drive capacity with new technology for extra power savings. However, the tech feels like more of the same in performance terms.

title: Qualcomm CEO says Intel ‘not an option’ for chip production — yet
summary: Amon said that Intel “is not an option today,” but left open the possibility for a future partnership, adding “we would like Intel to be an option.”

title: OpenAI widely thought to be Broadcom's mystery $10 billion custom AI processor customer — order could be for millions of AI processors
summary: Broadcom has secured a $10 billion deal to supply custom AI accelerators and rack-scale hardware to an undisclosed customer — widely believed to be OpenAI — signaling that the design has been validated and full-scale deployment is on track for late 2026.

title: Anthropic blocks Chinese-controlled firms from Claude AI — cites 'legal, regulatory, and security risks'
summary: Anthropic has updated its terms of service to block access to its Claude AI models for any company that’s majority-owned or controlled by Chinese entities.

title: Acer Predator Helios Neo 16 gaming laptop is $300 off at Best Buy — RTX 5070 Ti, 32GB RAM, and 240Hz OLED screen can be yours for $1,600
summary: The RTX 5070 Ti is a big step up over the 8GB RTX 5070 when it comes to gaming laptops, but it's often an even bigger jump in price. Thankfully, Acer has your back with its Predator Helios Neo 16S AI that's on sale for just $1,599 right now at Best Buy.

title: Synopsys adds generative AI for chip development with Synopsys.ai Copilot design software
summary: Having designed an AI-enhanced EDA toolset, Synopsys now adds Assistive and Creative capabilities for chip designers that can accelerate chip design across all phases.

summary: Gigabyte launches the AI Top CXL R5X4 add-in-card to expand the amount of memory on the brand's TRX50 AI Top and W790 AI Top motherboards.

title: Nvidia signs $1.5 billion deal with cloud startup Lambda to rent back its own AI chips — 18,000 GPUs will be leased over 4 years, as Lambda gears up for its IPO
summary: Nvidia, the source of origin for much of the contemporary AI hype, is now looking to rent back its own chips from Lambda. The Green Team is already a heavy investor in the AI startup but will now lease 18,000 GPUs over a 4-year long period, helping Lambda ready up for its upcoming IPO.

title: Moto G06 Power is here with 7,000mAh battery, Moto G06 tags along
summary: Motorola announced its latest G-series phones – the G06 and G06 Power. The latter features the largest battery fitted on a Moto phone to date with its 7,000mAh cell. title: AI-powered PromptLocker ransomware is just an NYU research project — the code worked as a typical ransomware, selecting targets, exfiltrating selected data and encrypting volumes
summary: ESET's discovery of the first AI-powered ransomware turned out to be an NYU research project.

title: Portable 3D-printed device claimed to produce enough drinking water from thin air for a family of four every day - Water from Air project says it can capture 1.6 gallons of drinking water per day
summary: Portable 3D printed Water from Air device is claimed to be able to capture 1.6 gallons (6 liters) of drinking water per day.

summary: The Lenovo Legion Go 2 is beefier than before, with a more powerful chip and an OLED screen, but it’s also quite expensive.

title: US offers $10M reward for snitching on trio of Russians that hacked critical infrastructure
summary: The U.S. Department of State offered a $10 million bounty via the Rewards for Justice program for information related to a trio of Russian hackers.

title: Windows 11 August 2025 security update is causing unintended UAC prompts to appear for non-admin users — some apps are crashing
summary: Microsoft's latest Windows update for Windows 11, Windows 10 is causing unintended UAC prompts to appear in certain cases for non-admin users.

title: Solar-powered Logitech keyboard appears on Amazon Mexico — MX Keys S look-alike promises up to 10 years of power
summary: Logitech will soon launch the company's new Signature Slim Solar+ keyboard, which features a solar panel to charge its battery.

title: Linux Mint 22.2 ‘Zara’ released with native fingerprint support – also has a new syncing sticky note system
summary: Linux Mint 22.2 ‘Zara’ has been released today, offering native fingerprint biometrics, an updated Sticky Notes app, and improved update management.

title: China injects tens of billions of dollars in chipmaking tools, but it's easily more than a decade behind the market leaders — Here's why
summary: China’s chip industry excels at mature nodes but remains at least a decade behind in advanced lithography.

title: Report says North Korea is also posting fake jobs to steal crypto — because using AI to get fake employees real jobs at US tech firms wasn't enough
summary: North Korea is reportedly posting fake jobs in the cryptocurrency sector as part of a bid to steal applicants' crypto assets.

title: Intel’s old NAND plant in China is now officially registered as SK hynix after US imposes new sanctions that limit fab upgrades in China
summary: According to Chinese registry filings, the plant's name officially changed to reflect its ownership by SK hynix on September 1.

summary: First details about AMD's next-generation AI rack solution emerge: three racks, 64 compute racks, 256 Instinct MI500-series GPUs, 64 EPYC 'Verano' CPUs, 18 switch trays.

title: Bill Gates’ 48-year-old Microsoft 6502 BASIC goes open source
summary: Microsoft BASIC for 6502 Microprocessor - Version 1.1 source code is now available on Github, under the MIT license.

title: Nvidia's next-gen AI chip could double the price of H20 if China export is approved — Chinese firms still consider Nvidia's B30A a good deal
summary: Chinese companies are hungry for more computing power and are willing to pay for it.

title: Noctua's first AIO liquid cooler delayed to Q2 2026, company reveals new roadmap — cooler was originally slated for a Q1 2026 release
summary: Noctua announced its first-ever mainstream AIO liquid cooler back at Computex earlier this year, where it said it would launch sometime in the first quarter of 2026. Now, thanks to an updated roadmap, we know that it's planned for Q2 2026. Noctua's AIO will be based on Asetek's G8 V2 pump design.
